meanings.definition: A type of insect that burrows into wood.
meanings.sent1: The woodborers damaged the wooden fence by burrowing into it.
meanings.sent2: We had to call an exterminator to get rid of the woodborers infesting our porch.
meanings.sent3: The woodborers threw a tiny party inside the old tree trunk they were burrowing into.
meanings.sent4: The woodborers were like tiny miners excavating their way through the wooden mine.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the woodborers gnawing through the wood was like a tiny orchestra playing a symphony.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that bores into wood.
meanings.sent1: The woodborers used a drill to create holes in the wooden planks.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter was skilled at using various woodborers to create intricate designs.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous woodborers carved funny faces into the wooden statue.
meanings.sent4: The woodborers were like artists, sculpting their masterpieces out of the solid wood.
meanings.sent5: The woodborers' ability to bore into wood with precision was truly impressive.
